column5: Well the skunk is finally over - but barely!  We launched outta the public launch behind the now closed Tip of the Bay. Real nice launch  We were out on the water and set up fishing by around 7 am. First fish was a medium sized pike that really fought well. Thought I was into a good walleye and was dissapointed when I finally got to see it. It was caught off the boards in about 45 feet of water using a deep diver perch pattern.   After that it was nothing for a couple of hours - then the rigger went off and I got a 6.3 lb walleye - not hugh by Quinte standards but it was good to finally get one. Walleye was caught on a glass perch ( purple ) down 32 feet off the riggers.         Thanks to Dann  ( skeeter ) for being such a great net man!  Don
thanks for the report, for some reason the head on that pickerel looks tiny compared to its body
Thats cause Dann is a better net man then he is a photographer - lol   Don
Thanks Don! Good outing for you...but aren't they all ?
Can't wait for the G2G for next year.   Don
well if some one was prying your gill plate open like that your head would look small too!!!!! Don always wanted to be a dentist---open up and say AHHHHHHHHHH. but it sure was a fun day!
Here's a better picture of the walleye - must have been the way that i was holding it    And by the way - this came by us also:
Always a pleasure to see them nice fish. Thanks fer sharin'.
Great report!!!!  I'm happy to catch any fish!!!
